Firm up your extended leg, drop your hip as low as you can and keep a strong, straight, supporting arm.
horizon_lunge.Pose Benefits: Opens the hips and glutes.  Strengthens the arms, legs, and spine.

downward_dog_bent_knees.Pose Description: From Downward-Facing Dog, the arms are extended straight and the knees are bent with the sits bones tilted up and reaching for the sky in dog tilt.  The belly is pulled in and up.  The gaze is toward the belly.
downward_dog_bent_knees.Pose Benefits: Calms the brain and helps relieve stress and mild depression.  Energizes the body.  Stretches the shoulders, hamstrings, calves, arches, and hands.  Strengthens the arms and legs.  Helps relieve the symptoms of menopause.  Relieves menstrual discomfort when done with the head supported.  Helps prevent osteoporosis.  Improves digestion.  Relieves headache, insomnia, back pain, and fatigue.  Therapeutic for high blood pressure, asthma, flat feet, sciatica, and sinusitis.  Warms up the ankles, toes, knees and hamstrings.

lunge_arm_forward.Pose Description: From Lunge, the arm (on the side of the body that correlates to the front bent knee) is extended forward with fingers spread wide and the palm facing inward.  The other arm remains on the inside of the thigh with the palm rooted into the earth for support.  The gaze is forward.
lunge_arm_forward.Pose Benefits: Creates flexible strength.  Promotes stability in the front and back of the torso.  Tones the lower body.  Opens the shoulders.

lunge_kneeling_arm_forward.Pose Name: Lunge on the Knee with Arm Extended Forward
lunge_kneeling_arm_forward.Pose Description: From Lunge on the Knee, the arm (on the side of the body that correlates to the front bent knee) is extended forward with fingers spread wide and the palm facing inward.  The other arm remains on the inside of the thigh with the palm rooted into the earth for support.  The gaze is forward.
lunge_kneeling_arm_forward.Pose Benefits: Creates flexible strength.  Promotes stability in the front and back of the torso.  Tones the lower body.  Opens the shoulders.

warrior_i_cactus_arms.Pose Description: From Warrior I, ground down into your back leg and keep your knee at a 90-degree bend over your front ankle.  Lift your chest upward and back.  Widen your arms into a cactus shape as you expand through your chest.  Elbows are wide and drawing away from the body.  Shoulder blades are pressed together.  Fingers are spread wide.  Eye gaze is upward and the neck is a natural extension of your spine.
warrior_i_cactus_arms.Pose Benefits: Stretches the chest, shoulders, arms, neck, belly, groins (psoas) and the muscles of the back.  Strengthens and stretches the thighs, calves and ankles.

supine_belly_twist.Pose Description: From a supine position, bend both knees and bring them inward towards your chest.  Extend your arms out to a T-shape and drop your bent knees to one direction.  Take your face to the opposite direction and soften.  Repeat on the opposite side.
supine_belly_twist.Pose Benefits: Stretches the back muscles and spine.  Relaxes the lower back, spine and hips.

fallen_triangle.Pose Description: Begin in One Legged Plank or Three Legged Downward-Facing Dog.  Bend the knee of your lifted leg, tuck it in toward your chest then thread it under and through toward your opposite hand.  Straighten the threaded leg, shift your weight to your grounding hand and lift your opposite arm to the sky.  At the same time, lift your hips and chest upwards.  Keep a straight and stable grounding arm from palm, wrist to shoulder.  Spread your legs as wide apart as possible to form a big X shape with your body and try to press your feet flat.  Take your gaze to your hand in the sky.
fallen_triangle.Pose Benefits: Strengthens the core, arms and glutes.  Stretches your chest, legs, shoulders, and neck.  Opens the hips, chest and shoulders.

triangle_bound.Pose Description: From Extended Side Angle, extend your top hand to the sky, then wrap it behind your back into the crease of your hip.  Feed your bottom hand under your front thigh to reach for opposite fingers tips then clasp hands.  Firm your back leg, press your hips forward as your chest and torso rotate toward the sky, then begin to extend your front leg until it is completely straight.  Draw your knee caps up and activate your toes.  Bring your gaze over your top shoulder.
triangle_bound.Pose Benefits: Opens your chest and shoulders, strengthens your legs, and lengthens your sides.  Stretches the inner thigh.

head_to_knee_revolved.Pose Description: Sit on the floor with your torso upright and your legs wide.  Bend one knee and snug the heel into the opposite groin of your extended leg.  Lift your arms up overhead then take a side bend stretch toward your extended leg.  Try to press your bottom shoulder against the inside of your extended knee.  When your knee is straight, twist your torso toward the sky.  Lift your opposite arm up, lean back slightly, and then, sweep it behind your ear and take hold of the outside edge of your extended foot.  Press your elbows away from each other, using them like a crank to help twist your upper torso further.  Turn your head to look at the sky.
head_to_knee_revolved.Pose Benefits: Stretches the spine, shoulders, obliques and hamstrings.

head_to_knee_iii_preparation.Pose Description: Transitional pose to get into Head to Knee III.

plank_side_fallen_triangle.Pose Description: Begin in Side Plank on the Knee.  Ground down into your supported arm and extend your bottom leg out to the side, keeping the leg and foot lifted.  The supported shoulder stays stacked over the wrist.  The outer edge of the back foot is rooted to the ground.  Use your bottom obliques to keep lifting from the core.
plank_side_fallen_triangle.Pose Benefits: Strengthens the arms, belly and legs.  Stretches and strengthens the wrists.  Improves balance and focus.

wild_thing_forearm.Pose Description: From Forearm Plank, lift one leg up toward the sky and tap the toes back behind the opposite, supported foot.  Roll your chest upwards and allow your hips to follow.  Keep your bottom supporting shoulder stacked over your elbow.  Reach your opposite arm up and toward the front.  Allow your neck to relax with your eye gaze forward.
wild_thing_forearm.Pose Benefits: Stretches the chest, shoulders, back, and throat.  Strengthens the shoulders and opens the hips, hip flexors, and thighs.

plank_side_tree.Pose Description: Come into your Side Plank.  Stay rooted in your bottom arm and keep your shoulder in line with your grounded wrist.  Lift your top leg up and bend your knee to bring your heel inward.  Using your top arm, guide your heel towards your groin for your tree legs.  Avoid placing your foot on your knee.  Once you have your tree legs, reach your top arm up.
plank_side_tree.Pose Benefits: Strengthens the arms, belly and legs.  Strengthens the wrists and knee joints.  Improves sense of balance and focus.

plank_side_star.Pose Description: From Side Plank, stay rooted in your bottom arm and keep your shoulder in line with your grounded wrist.  Lift your top leg up as high as you can.  Activate your toes and keep your core engaged.
plank_side_star.Pose Benefits: Strengthens the arms, belly and legs.  Strengthens the wrists.  Improves sense of balance and focus.

fish_lotus.Pose Description: Begin seated in Lotus or Half Lotus and lean back to your forearms.  Lift your chest to create an arch in your upper back.  Drop the crown of your head to the floor.  Keep your hands on your feet or rest them by your side.
fish_lotus.Pose Benefits: A traditional text states that Matsyāsana is the "destroyer of all diseases".  Opens the chest, throat and abdomen.

corpse_front_prayer.Pose Description: Lie all the way down onto your belly and extend your legs straight back.  Widen out your elbows and bring your hands in prayer.  Rest your Third Eye Center, the space between your eyes, on your prayer palms.  Relax your neck, belly, glutes and legs.  Allow your heels to soften to the sides.  Rest and breathe.
corpse_front_prayer.Pose Benefits: Relaxes the body and calms the mind.

cobra_king.Pose Description: Begin by lying flat on your belly.  Place your palms directly under your shoulders and spread your fingers wide.  Roll your shoulder blades down your back toward your hips while you squeeze your elbows in toward your ribcage.  Spread your legs so your knees reach toward the edges of the mat.  Begin to press into your hands and straighten your arms to lift your torso off the mat.  Keep your arms by your rib cage and your shoulders rolled away from your ears.  Reach your head high and then take the crown of your head up and back.  Bend your knees and take your toes toward your head.
cobra_king.Pose Benefits: Opens the chest, shoulders and psoas.  Strengthens the spine.

pigeon_king_full.Pose Description: Come into your King Cobra and walk your hands back underneath your shoulders.  Bring your chest as high up as possible by pushing the ground away with your palms.  With your arms by your rib cage and your shoulders rolled away from your ears, reach your head high and then take the crown of your head up and back.  Bend your knees and take your toes toward your head.  Lift your left hand off the floor and reach towards your left knee cap for a strong grip.  Once stable, lift your right hand off the floor and grip your right knee cap.
pigeon_king_full.Pose Benefits: Opens the chest, shoulders and psoas.  Strengthens the spine.

headstand_tripod_lotus.Pose Description: From Tripod Headstand, take your Lotus legs in the sky.  The weight of the body is balanced between the crown of the head and the palms of the hands with the elbows bent in a 90-degree angle and the fingers forward.  The head and hands are spaced equally forming an equilateral triangle.
headstand_tripod_lotus.Pose Benefits: Strengthens the arms, legs, and spine.

headstand_tripod_eagle.Pose Description: From Tripod Headstand, come into your Eagle legs.  Wrap one knee behind the other.  If you can, take the double wrap by hooking your toes behind your calf.
headstand_tripod_eagle.Pose Benefits: Calms the brain and helps relieve stress and mild depression.  Stimulates the pituitary and pineal glands.  Strengthens the arms, legs, and spine.  Strengthens the lungs.  Tones the abdominal organs.  Improves digestion.  Helps relieve the symptoms of menopause.  Therapeutic for asthma, infertility, insomnia, and sinusitis.

headstand_tripod_spiral_legs.Pose Description: From Tripod Headstand, the legs open and extend to the sides as in Wide Splits and then spiral, first in one direction and then the other.  The gaze is straight.
headstand_tripod_spiral_legs.Pose Benefits: Calms the brain and helps relieve stress and mild depression.  Stimulates the pituitary and pineal glands.  Strengthens the arms, legs, and spine.  Strengthens the lungs.  Tones the abdominal organs.  Improves digestion.  Helps relieve the symptoms of menopause.  Therapeutic for asthma, infertility, insomnia and sinusitis.

plank_side_shiva.Pose Name: Side Plank with Foot Behind the Head
plank_side_shiva.Pose Description: Begin seated in Foot Behind the Head I.  Release your prayer palms.  Turn your body to the side and place your palms on the ground, arms in line with each other.  Press into both palms to lift the hips up to your Side Plank.  Stay grounded with your inside palm and lift your outside arm up towards the sky.
plank_side_shiva.Pose Benefits: Strengthens the core and arms.  Stretches the spine, hips and hamstrings.

plank_kneeling_side.Pose Description: From Box, one leg is extended back with the outside edge of the foot gripping the earth.  The top arm (on the same side of the body as the extended leg) is extended up to the sky with the fingers spread wide.  The supporting leg is bent and the foot and the knee are angled out for balance.  The supporting arm is straight and in line the extended arm with the joints stacked.  The pelvis is tucked under to protect the lumbar spine and the gaze is up.
plank_kneeling_side.Pose Benefits: Strengthens the arms, belly and legs.  Stretches and strengthens the wrists.  Stretches the backs of the legs.  Improves sense of balance and focus.

plank_dolphin_side.Pose Description: In this lateral arm balance position the weight is distributed equally between one forearm and one foot while the other arm extends up with the fingers spread wide and the other foot stacks on top.  The grounded (bottom) foot is flat and gripping the earth from the outside edge of the foot.  If flexibility of the foot is limited then instead of gripping the earth with a flat foot, the weight of the body is balanced on the side edge of the foot that is flexed instead of flat.  The shoulder blades firm against the back and then widen away from the spine drawing toward the tailbone.  Bandhas are engaged to maintain balance and stability.  The crown of the head reaches away from the neck and the gaze is up toward out or up toward the lifted hand.
plank_dolphin_side.Pose Benefits: Calms the brain and helps relieve stress and mild depression.  Stretches the shoulders, hamstrings, calves, and arches.  Strengthens the arms and legs.  Helps relieve the symptoms of menopause.  Helps prevent osteoporosis.  Improves digestion.  Relieves headache, insomnia, back pain, and fatigue.  Therapeutic for high blood pressure, asthma, flat feet, sciatica.

partridge.Pose Description: Come into your Side Plank and plant the bottom foot firmly into the ground.  Bend your top knee and reach your top arm up and back to catch the big toe.  Press your foot into your hand to form a bow shape with the upper body.  Keep expanding through the chest and stay strong in your arm that is grounded.
partridge.Pose Benefits: Strengthens the shoulders, arms, spine and legs.

plank_side_half_lotus.Pose Name: Side Plank with Bound Half Lotus
plank_side_half_lotus.Pose Description: Come into your Side Plank.  Stay rooted in your bottom arm and keep your shoulder in line with your grounded wrist.  Lift your top leg up and bend your knee to bring your heel inward.  Using your top arm, guide your heel towards your groin for half lotus.  Once you have your half lotus, reach your top arm up and behind to connect your fingers to your big toe.
plank_side_half_lotus.Pose Benefits: Strengthens the arms, belly and legs.  Strengthens the wrists and knee joints.  Improves sense of balance and focus.

seated_on_heels_prayer_twist.Pose Description: Start from Squatting Toe Balance pose.  Slowly twist to one side, hooking the elbow to the outside of the opposite knee.  Gaze is toward the sky.  If possible, release the hands, lower hand wraps around the knees and the other hand around the back and try to bind the hands.
seated_on_heels_prayer_twist.Pose Benefits: Strengthens arms, wrists and ankles.  Stretches the upper back.  Strengthens the abdominal muscles.

seated_on_heels_prayer_opened_knees.Pose Name: Squatting Toe Balance with Opened Knees
seated_on_heels_prayer_opened_knees.Pose Description: The weight of the body is seated on the heels with the knees open to the sides.  The hands are at the heart in prayer position.  The belly is pulled up and in toward the spine with the ribcage and chin lifted.  The gaze is forward and slightly down.
seated_on_heels_prayer_opened_knees.Pose Benefits: Strengthens arms, wrists and ankles.  Stretches the upper back.  Strengthens the abdominal muscles.  Opens the groin.  Tones the abdominal organs.

seated_on_heels_prayer.Pose Description: The weight of the body is seated on the heels with the knees closed and the hands are at the heart in prayer position.  The pelvis is tucked.  The belly is pulled up and in toward the spine.  The ribcage and chin are lifted.  The gaze is forward and slightly down.
seated_on_heels_prayer.Pose Benefits: Strengthens arms, wrists and ankles.  Stretches the upper back.  Strengthens the abdominal muscles.  Opens the groin.  Tones the abdominal organs.

seated_forward_bend_wide_angle.Pose Name: Seated Wide Legged Forward Bend I
seated_forward_bend_wide_angle.Pose Description: Begin in a seated position.  Lean your torso back slightly on your hands to lift and open your legs out to an angle.  Press your hands against the floor and slide your glutes forward, widening your legs more.  If you cannot sit comfortably on the floor, place a block or folded blanket under your glutes.  Rotate your thighs outwardly, pinning the outer thighs against the floor, so that the knee caps point straight up toward the sky.  Reach out through your heels and stretch your soles, pressing though the balls of your feet.  With your thigh bones pressed heavily into the floor and your knee caps pointing up at the sky, walk your hands forward between your legs.  Keep your arms long.  Move from your hip joints and maintain a long torso and spine as you fold forward.
seated_forward_bend_wide_angle.Pose Benefits: Stretches the insides and backs of the legs.  Strengthens the spine.

seated_forward_bend_wide_angle_ii.Pose Name: Seated Wide Legged Forward Bend II
seated_forward_bend_wide_angle_ii.Pose Description: Begin seated with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor, hands resting by your hips.  Keeping your spine straight, lean back slightly and lift your feet to table top, then straighten your legs.  Draw in your low back, lift your chest, and lengthen the front of your torso as you walk your index and middle (peace) fingers to your big toes.  Separate your legs into a wide straddle while keeping the big toe connection.
seated_forward_bend_wide_angle_ii.Pose Benefits: Improves balance and strengthens the core.  Stretches your hamstrings, abdominals, spine and hip flexors.

boat_bind_preparation.Pose Description: Transitional pose to get into Boat with Toe Hold.From Plow, reach your hands towards your toes and wrap your index and middle fingers around your big toes.  Keep your legs and core engaged to avoid putting too much pressure on the back of your neck.

head_to_knee_ii_preparation.Pose Description: Transitional pose to get into Head to Knee II.

crow_side_extended.Pose Description: Start from Side Crow (Preparation) and lean forward.  Bend the elbows, placing the hips and knees on top of the arms.  Lift the chin up and look forward.  Shift more weight onto the arms and tip over, take the feet off the floor and straighten the legs.
crow_side_extended.Pose Benefits: Strengthens arms and wrists.  Improves balance.  Tones the abdominal muscles.

plank_knee_to_elbow.Pose Description: Begin in a Plank or Downward-Facing Dog.  Lift one leg up and bend your knee in toward your chest.  Bring your hips and shoulders in line as you bring your kneecap toward your tricep (or elbow) to make contact.
plank_knee_to_elbow.Pose Benefits: Strengthens the arms, wrists, and spine.  Tones the abdomen.

downward_dog_leg_up_stack_hips_bind.Pose Name: Balancing Three Legged Downward-Facing Dog with Hip Opener
downward_dog_leg_up_stack_hips_bind.Pose Description: Begin in your Three Legged Downward-Facing Dog.  Shorten your stance slightly until your heel is grounded.  Bend your top knee and point your knee cap upward.  Maintain your Drishti and reach with your opposite hand to catch your foot or ankle.  Keep the shoulders squared and distribute your weight evenly between your grounded foot and hand.
downward_dog_leg_up_stack_hips_bind.Pose Benefits: Strengthens the hips and legs.  Improves balance and flexibility.

downward_dog_on_toes.Pose Description: From Downward-Facing Dog, the weight of the body is supported on the hands and the toes.  The ribcage is lifted.  The shoulder blades rotate back and open.  The heart is open.  The gaze is to the front and slightly down.
downward_dog_on_toes.Pose Benefits: Calms the brain and helps relieve stress and mild depression.  Energizes the body.  Stretches the shoulders, hamstrings, calves, arches, and hands.  Strengthens the arms and legs.  Helps relieve the symptoms of menopause.  Relieves menstrual discomfort when done with the head supported.  Helps prevent osteoporosis.  Improves digestion.  Relieves headache, insomnia, back pain, and fatigue.  Therapeutic for high blood pressure, asthma, flat feet, sciatica, and sinusitis.  Warms up the ankles and the toes.

downward_dog_hamstring.Pose Description: From Downward-Facing Dog, one knee is bent and one leg is straight with the sits bones tilted up and reaching for the sky.  The arms are straight with the eye of the elbows facing forward.  The palms are flat.  The knuckles are pressed evenly into the earth.  The heels alternatively lift and lower with the weight of the body equally distributed between the hands and the feet.  The ribcage is lifted and the heart is open.  Shoulders are squared, rotated back, down and inward.  The chin is lifted and the gaze is down and slightly forward.
downward_dog_hamstring.Pose Benefits: Calms the brain and helps relieve stress and mild depression.  Energizes the body.  Stretches the shoulders, hamstrings, calves, arches, and hands.  Strengthens the arms and legs.  Helps relieve the symptoms of menopause.  Relieves menstrual discomfort when done with the head supported.  Helps prevent osteoporosis.  Improves digestion.  Relieves headache, insomnia, back pain, and fatigue.  Therapeutic for high blood pressure, asthma, flat feet, sciatica, and sinusitis.  Warms up the ankles, toes, knees and hamstrings.

downward_dog_hand_to_ankle.Pose Description: From Downward-Facing Dog, the legs are straight with the sits bones tilted up and reaching for the sky.  The feet are flat with the heels firmly rooted.  One palm is flat with the knuckles evenly pressed into the earth.  The other hand reaches under the body and grasps the opposite ankle.  The spine is long and the heart is open toward the sky.  The neck is loose and the crown of the head is toward the earth.  The gaze is toward the center.
downward_dog_hand_to_ankle.Pose Benefits: Calms the brain and helps relieve stress and mild depression.  Energizes the body.  Stretches the shoulders, neck, hamstrings, calves, arches, and hands.  Strengthens the arms and legs.  Helps relieve the symptoms of menopause.  Relieves menstrual discomfort when done with the head supported.  Helps prevent osteoporosis.  Improves digestion.  Relieves headache, insomnia, back pain, and fatigue.  Therapeutic for high blood pressure, asthma, flat feet, sciatica, and sinusitis.

gate_reverse.Pose Description: From Box, one leg is extended back with the outside edge of the foot gripping the earth.  The top arm (on the same side of the body as the extended leg) is extended overhead to create a long side body stretch.  The supporting leg is bent and the foot and the knee are angled out for balance.  The supporting arm is straight and in line with the extended arm with the joints stacked.  The tailbone is down to protect the lumbar spine and the gaze is up.
gate_reverse.Pose Benefits: Strengthens the side body, arms, belly and legs.  Stretches and strengthens the wrists.  Stretches the backs of the legs.  Improves sense of balance and focus.

gate_preparation.Pose Description: Transitional pose to get into Gate or Reverse Gate.Begin in a kneeling position with your hips stacked over your knees.  Extend one leg out to the side.  Reach your arms out to a T with your wrists and shoulders in line.  Relax your shoulders and energize your hands.

bridge_preparation.Pose Description: Transitional pose to get into Bridge.From a supine position, on your back, bend your knees and walk your feet inward towards your hips to bring your heels directly in line with your knees, toes facing forward.  Flatten your shoulder blades down to the ground to create space in your chest and allow the back of your head to soften down.

bridge_leg_up.Pose Description: From Bridge pose, begin to extend one leg out in front, without dropping the hips.  If possible, bring the extended leg higher, toes pointing toward the sky.
bridge_leg_up.Pose Benefits: Stretches the rib cage, chest, neck and back muscles.  Tightens the gluts.  Strengthens the legs, knees and thighs.

setu.Pose Description: Begin lying down on your back.  Bend your knees, open your thighs to the side and bring your heels together.  Bring yourself up onto your elbows and drop onto the crown of your head.  Cross your arms over your chest to pull down on the shoulders.  Press into your heels and roll further onto the top of your head.  Press your pelvis upward as you extend your legs straight.
setu.Pose Benefits: Releases the neck.  Opens the belly and chest.  Strengthens the spine.

shoulderstand_supported_bridge.Pose Description: Begin in your Supported Shoulder Stand.  Place your palms on your lower ribs with the fingertips facing upward.  Walk your elbows in as close together as possible.  Bend your knees and drop your feet to the ground.  With the hips high, begin to extend one leg straight and then the other.  Zip up your legs, press them together finding a slight internal rotation and press the big toes down.  Keep lifting the hips high and press your chest up and back.  Keep the natural curvature of your spine and your eye gaze upward.
shoulderstand_supported_bridge.Pose Benefits: Stretches the shoulders, chest and back.  Strengthens the hips and legs.

marichi_iii_traditional_preparation.Pose Description: Transitional pose to get into Sage Marichi's III.

seated_forward_bend_ii_preparation.Pose Description: Transitional pose to get into Seated Forward Bend II.

super_soldier.Pose Description: Begin in Lizard with Straight Arms, palms rooted and your back knee lifted.  Slide your inside shoulder underneath the thigh of your front bent knee, staying squared to the front.  Place your outside hand wider and slightly forward than your mat and come up on your fingertips.  Step your back foot in and shorten your stance.  Using the balance of your outside hand, shift the weight to your front foot and at that same time, float your back leg up.  Once stable, bend your top knee, reach for your foot or ankle with your inside hand and open your hip.  Straighten your standing leg as much as possible and continue lifting your top bent knee to the sky to further the stretch.  Repeat on opposite side.
super_soldier.Pose Benefits: Stretches inner thighs, psoas, and hamstrings.  Improves balance.

tree_toppling.Pose Description: Shift your weight to one foot and lift your opposite foot of the ground.  Hands can be interlaced at your back or in prayer.  Hinge forward through your Warrior III and try to connect your chest to your standing leg.   Keep your hips squared off.  Stay balanced and focused.
tree_toppling.Pose Benefits: Strengthens the ankles and legs.  Strengthens the shoulders and muscles of the back.  Tones the abdomen.

splits_standing_bent_knee.Pose Description: Begin in Standing Splits, bend your top knee and stack one hip on top of the other.  Reach around with your opposite hand to catch your top foot or ankle.  Gaze can be slightly out in front or for more of a challenge, crown of the head down and connect your chest to your standing leg.  Keep a micro-bend in your standing leg and avoid locking it out.
splits_standing_bent_knee.Pose Benefits: Stretches the psoas, hamstrings, calves and thighs.  Improves balance.

splits_standing_bound.Pose Description: Begin in Standing Splits with your gaze slightly forward down in front of you.  Engage your core and mindfully wrap one hand to your ankle and then the other.  Continue to keep your hips squared and find your balance.
splits_standing_bound.Pose Benefits: Stretches the hamstrings, calves, and thighs.  Strengthens the thighs, knees, and ankles.  Stretches the back of the leg, the front thigh and groin.  Improves balance.

warrior_i_eagle_backbend.Pose Name: Warrior I with Eagle Arm Backbend
warrior_i_eagle_backbend.Pose Description: Begin in Warrior I with Eagle Arms.  Hinge your chest upward and back.  Take your gaze towards your fingers and beyond, allowing your neck to release back.  Keep sending energy to the outer edge of your back foot, a 90-degree bend in your front knee and stay squared towards the front.  Elbows stay in line with your shoulders and your forearms press away from your face.
warrior_i_eagle_backbend.Pose Benefits: Stretches and strengthens the shoulders, arms and back muscles.  Stretches the thighs, calves and ankles.  Opens the chest and heart.

warrior_i_eagle.Pose Description: Begin in Warrior I and stay strong in your legs.  Place one elbow on top of the other for your eagle arm bind.  Lift your elbows in line with your shoulders and draw your forearms away from your face.  If possible, keep wrapping your arms until your palms meet; otherwise press the back of your hands towards each other.
warrior_i_eagle.Pose Benefits: Stretches and strengthens the shoulders, arms and back muscles.  Stretches the thighs, calves and ankles.

warrior_twist_extended.Pose Description: From a standing position, the legs are in a wide stance with the feet aligned and flat on the earth.  The inner thighs scissor toward each other with Mula Bandha engaged.  The front knee is bent in a 90-degree angle and tracks the front ankle.  The back leg is straight with most of the body's weight pressed into the outside edge of the back foot gripping the earth.  From the center of the back, between the shoulder blades, the arms move away from the torso that is rotated up toward the sky.  One arm is actively reaching up and the other actively reaching down utilizing the fingers tips or flat palm only as a un-weighted balancing tool.  The elbow of the bottom hand is either on the inside or the outside of the bent front knee, depending on the degree of flexibility available.  Beginning students should keep their head in a neutral position, looking straight forward, or turn it to look down and protect the neck.  More experienced students can turn the head and gaze up at the top thumb.
warrior_twist_extended.Pose Benefits: Wrings out the lower back and the digestive and vital organs of the mid-body.  Opens the chest.  Stretches the pectoralis minor muscles.

warrior_twist.Pose Description: From Warrior I with Prayer Hands, the torso twists toward the sky as the heart opens.  The opposite elbow connects with the outside of the front bent knee.  The gaze is toward the sky unless the neck is sensitive then the gaze stays down toward the earth.
warrior_twist.Pose Benefits: Wrings out the lower back and the digestive and vital organs of the mid-body.  Opens the chest.  Stretches the pectoralis minor muscles.

warrior_i_hands_on_hips_forward.Pose Name: Warrior I Halfway Fold with Hands on Hips
warrior_i_hands_on_hips_forward.Pose Description: From a standing position, the legs are in a wide stance with the feet aligned and flat on the earth.  The back foot is in a 60-degree angle toward the front.  The hips are squared.  The inner thighs are rotated toward each other.  The front knee is bent in a 90-degree angle directly above the ankle.  The ribcage is lifted.  The hands are resting on the hips.  The shoulder blades are back and down, squeezing together.  The lower body stays static.  The upper torso gently bends forward from the crease of the hip with a straight line.  The gaze is forward.
warrior_i_hands_on_hips_forward.Pose Benefits: Stretches the chest, lungs, neck, belly and groin (psoas).  Strengthens the back muscles.  Strengthens and stretches the thighs, calves and ankles.

warrior_humble.Pose Description: Begin in Warrior I with Hands Interlaced.  Keep the connection with your interlaced hands, palms touching and begin to bow forward toward the inside of your front thigh.  Keep a 90-degree bend in your front knee and a strong back leg by rooting down into the straight edge of your foot.  Lift your interlaced hands off your lower back, up and over your head.  Relax your neck and your face muscles.  Try to keep your shoulders and hips squared toward the front.
warrior_humble.Pose Benefits: Stretches the chest, shoulders, neck, belly and groin (psoas).  Strengthens the shoulders, arms and back muscles.  Strengthens and stretches the thighs, calves and ankles.

star_arms_up.Pose Description: From Star pose, the arms are straight and lifted up toward the sky.  The palms are together.
star_arms_up.Pose Benefits: Strengthens and lengthens the body.  Aligns the spine.  Strengthens legs, ankles, abdomen and back.

warrior_i_eagle_forward.Pose Name: Warrior I Halfway Fold with Eagle Arms
warrior_i_eagle_forward.Pose Description: Begin in Warrior I with Eagle Arms.  Hinge from your hip keeping a flat back and your neck a natural extension of your spine.  Keep sending energy to the outer edge of your back foot, a 90-degree bend in your front knee and stay squared towards the front.  Elbows stay in line with your shoulders and your forearms press away from your face.
warrior_i_eagle_forward.Pose Benefits: Stretches and strengthens the shoulders, arms and back muscles.  Stretches the thighs, calves and ankles.

warrior_humble_preparation.Pose Description: Begin in Warrior I.  Ground down into your back leg and keep a 90-degree bend over your front leg.  Take your hands behind you toward your lower back, press your shoulder blades to touch, and interlace your fingers.  Try to connect your palms and keep that connection throughout the pose.  Expand your chest as you take a mini backbend.  Draw your interlaced hands down your back thigh as you lift through your sternum.  Keep your hips squared toward the front.  Gaze upwards.
warrior_humble_preparation.Pose Benefits: Stretches the chest, shoulders, neck, belly and groin (psoas).  Strengthens the shoulders, arms and back muscles.  Strengthens and stretches the thighs, calves and ankles.

figure_four_twist_extended.Pose Name: Revolved Figure Four with Arms Extended
figure_four_twist_extended.Pose Description: Begin by coming into your Revolved Figure Four.  Ensure the top of your arm and the sole of your foot have strong contact then begin to expand your arms open, bottom hand to the earth and top had to the sky.
figure_four_twist_extended.Pose Benefits: Stretches the lower back and your hip.  Increases the flexibility of the spine and back.  Stretches the shoulders.  Challenges the balance.

figure_four_twist.Pose Description: Begin by coming into your Figure Four.  Elongate your spine as you sit a little deeper.  Twist your upper body toward your flexed foot and place the back of your arm on the sole of your foot.  You can also create more space in your twist by releasing your prayer palms and placing your closest hand to the sole of your foot at the same time guiding the top of the opposite arm toward the foot and once stable, revert back to your prayer palms.
figure_four_twist.Pose Benefits: Stretches the lower back and your hip.  Increases the flexibility of the spine and back.  Stretches the shoulders.  Challenges the balance.

chair_twist.Pose Description: From Chair with Prayer Hands, the upper body twists to one side with the heart opening toward the sky.  The bottom elbow is on the outside of the opposite knee and the upper elbow reaches toward the sky.  Gaze is toward the sky or to the earth if the neck is sensitive.
chair_twist.Pose Benefits: Stretches the lower back.  Increases the flexibility of the spine and back.  Stretches the shoulders.  Challenges the balance.  Powerful detoxification of toxic food, drink, thoughts, etc.

chair_side_twist.Pose Description: From Chair, one arm reaches back and the other reaches forward.  The ribcage is lifted and the heart is open.  The hips and knees stay squared to the front and the twist comes from the midsection.  The gaze is toward the back hand, unless it hurts your neck, then the gaze can be forward.
chair_side_twist.Pose Benefits: Increases the flexibility of the spine and back.  Strengthens the legs.  Increases flexibility of the hip and knee joints.  Improves balance.

downward_dog_knee_to_forehead_kneeling.Pose Name: Plank on the Knees with Knee to Forehead
downward_dog_knee_to_forehead_kneeling.Pose Description: From Plank on the Knees, one knee is pulled into the chest or to the forehead as flexibility allows.  The belly is pulled up and in.  The back is arched in a Cobra position with the chin tucked.  The gaze is toward the back.
downward_dog_knee_to_forehead_kneeling.Pose Benefits: Calms the brain and helps relieve stress and mild depression.  Energizes the body.  Stretches the shoulders, neck, hamstrings, calves, arches, and hands.  Strengthens the arms and legs.  Helps relieve the symptoms of menopause.  Relieves menstrual discomfort when done with the head supported.  Helps prevent osteoporosis.  Improves digestion.  Relieves headache, insomnia, back pain, and fatigue.  Therapeutic for high blood pressure, asthma, flat feet, sciatica, and sinusitis.  Warms up the ankles and the toes.  Strengthens abdominal muscles.

plank_leg_up_kneeling.Pose Name: One Legged Plank on the Knees
plank_leg_up_kneeling.Pose Description: The body is parallel to the earth, and supported by straight arms and one knee.  The other leg is extended off the earth and reaches back with active toes.  The abdomen is pulled up toward the spine.  The pelvis is tucked.  The neck is a natural extension of the spine.  The chin is slightly tucked.  The palms are flat and the elbows are close to the side body.  The joints are stacked with the wrists, elbows and shoulders in a straight line perpendicular to the earth.  The gaze follows the spine and the eyes are focused down toward the earth.
plank_leg_up_kneeling.Pose Benefits: Strengthens the arms, wrists and spine.  Tones the abdomen.

plank_dolphin_knee_to_elbow.Pose Name: Forearm Plank with Knee to Tricep
plank_dolphin_knee_to_elbow.Pose Description: From Forearm Plank, lift one leg up and bend your knee in toward your chest.  Keep your hips and shoulders in line as you bring your kneecap toward your tricep to make contact.
plank_dolphin_knee_to_elbow.Pose Benefits: Strengthens the shoulders and spine.  Tones the abdomen.

plank_dolphin_kneeling.Pose Description: From Box, walk your hands forward and drop to your forearms.  Palms are flat, fingers spread wide.  Shoulders are in line with elbows and wrists in line with elbows.  Drop your hips until they are in line with your shoulders.  Engage your core.  Your gaze is downward and your neck is a natural extension of your spine.
plank_dolphin_kneeling.Pose Benefits: Strengthens the arms, shoulders, wrists and spine.  Tones the abdomen.

plank_knee_to_opposite_elbow.Pose Name: Plank with Knee to Opposite Tricep
plank_knee_to_opposite_elbow.Pose Description: Begin in a Plank or Downward-Facing Dog.  Lift one leg up and bend your knee in toward your chest.  Bring your hips and shoulders in line as you bring your kneecap toward your opposite tricep (or elbow) to make contact.
plank_knee_to_opposite_elbow.Pose Benefits: Strengthens the arms, wrists, and spine.  Tones the abdomen.

plank_awkward.Pose Description: Begin in a strong Plank, shoulders over wrists, fingers spread wide and heels stacked over your toes.  Slightly shift your weight to your right palm and lift your left arm forward.  Once you find your balance, lift right leg up and find your center of gravity by actively keeping your core engaged.  Energize through your floating fingers and toes.  Your neck is a natural extension of your spine and your eye gaze is downward.  Hold, and then repeat on opposite side.
plank_awkward.Pose Benefits: Improves balance and focus.  Strengthens the shoulders, arms and entire core.

downward_dog_leg_up_kneeling.Pose Name: Extended One Legged Plank on the Knees
downward_dog_leg_up_kneeling.Pose Description: From One Legged Plank on the Knees, press back and reach the extended leg toward the sky.  The gaze is down.
downward_dog_leg_up_kneeling.Pose Benefits: Tones and strengthens the standing leg.  Improves flexibility.  Opens the hips and shoulders.

lord_of_the_fishes_half.Pose Description: Begin in a seated position.  Bend one knee so the sole of your foot is close to the opposite inner thigh.  Bend your opposite knee in, foot on the floor, heel to the outside of your bent thigh.  Extend your arm (same side of your Lotus leg) high into the sky and begin to twist it to the outside of your bent knee.  Use your opposite hand as leverage to twist deeper.  Hook your elbow to the outside of your thigh and gaze over your back shoulder.  If you want to extend your twist deeper, wrap your arm around the shin of your bent knee and sweep your opposite arm around to meet it.  Catch opposite fingertips or the wrist.  Keep a long spine.
lord_of_the_fishes_half.Pose Benefits: Stretches the shoulders, spine, ankles, inner thighs, and abdominal muscles.

easy_forward.Pose Description: From your Easy, walk your hands forward.  Allow your back to round and your head and arms to relax out in front of you.  Purposefully send your sit bones towards the ground.  Repeat with the opposite shin crossed in front.
easy_forward.Pose Benefits: Stretches the hips and glutes.  Strengthens the back muscles by elongating the spine.

easy_twist.Pose Description: From Easy, take a twist.  Place one palm behind your hip bone and the other across your body to the outside of the opposite knee.  Sit up straight and initiate a twist from the belly, press into your grounded palm, gaze over your back shoulder.
easy_twist.Pose Benefits: Stretches the back muscles and spine.

child_wide_side_lean.Pose Description: From Wide Child's, the forehead rolls to one side and then the other.
child_wide_side_lean.Pose Benefits: Gently stretches the hips, thighs, and ankles.  Calms the brain and helps relieve stress and fatigue.  Relieves back and neck pain when done with head and torso supported.

lunge_crescent_kneeling_cactus_arms.Pose Name: Crescent Lunge on the Knee with Cactus Arms
lunge_crescent_kneeling_cactus_arms.Pose Description: From Crescent Lunge on the Knee, lift your chest upward and back.  Widen your arms into a cactus shape as you expand through your chest.  Elbows are wide and drawing away from the body.  Shoulder blades are pressed together.  Fingers are spread wide.  Eye gaze is upward and the neck is a natural extension of your spine.
lunge_crescent_kneeling_cactus_arms.Pose Benefits: Stretches the chest, shoulders, arms, neck, belly, groins (psoas) and the muscles of the back.  Strengthens and stretches the thighs, calves and ankles.

lunge_crescent_kneeling_twist.Pose Name: Crescent Lunge Twist on the Knee
lunge_crescent_kneeling_twist.Pose Description: The front foot of one leg is rooted on the earth with the knee directly above and tracking the ankle in a 90-degree angle.  The knee of the back leg is down on the earth.  The inner thighs scissor toward each other and the pelvis is tucked under with the ribcage lifted and the chin slightly tucked.  The spine is long and extended.  The heart is open.  The torso twists toward one side and the arm corresponding toward the back leg reaches toward the back.  Both arms are straight.  Wrists and the fingers are extended and spread wide.  Gaze is over the back shoulder.
lunge_crescent_kneeling_twist.Pose Benefits: Creates flexible strength.  Promotes stability in the front and back of the torso.  Tones the lower body.  Stretches the chest, lungs, shoulders, arms, neck, belly, groins (psoas) and the muscles of the back.  Strengthens and stretches the thighs, calves and ankles.

lunge_kneeling_twist_extended.Pose Name: Revolved Crescent Lunge on the Knee with Arms Extended
lunge_kneeling_twist_extended.Pose Description: From Revolved Crescent Lunge on the Knee, slowly release the hands.  Bottom hand can touch the floor or float, if needed, use a block to support.  Top hand reaches up toward the sky.  Keep both hands straight and heart remains open.  Gaze is upwards toward the top hand.
lunge_kneeling_twist_extended.Pose Benefits: In addition to the benefits from Revolved Crescent Lunge on the Knee pose, it opens the shoulders and strengthens the back muscles.

lunge_crescent_kneeling_hands_on_hips_fo.Pose Name: Crescent Lunge Halfway Fold on the Knee with Hands on Hips
lunge_crescent_kneeling_hands_on_hips_fo.Pose Description: From Crescent Lunge on the Knee with Hands on Hips, hinge forward with a flat back.  The lower body stays static.  The hips are squared towards the front.  The upper torso gently bends forward from the crease of the hip with a straight line from the crown of the head to the back knee.  The gaze is forward and the navel is drawn inward to protect the lower back.
lunge_crescent_kneeling_hands_on_hips_fo.Pose Benefits: Creates flexible strength.  Promotes stability in the front and back of the torso and strengthens the core.  Tones the lower body.

lunge_crescent_kneeling_forward_arms_sid.Pose Name: Crescent Lunge Halfway Fold on the Knee with Airplane Arms
lunge_crescent_kneeling_forward_arms_sid.Pose Description: From Crescent Lunge on the Knee, hinge your chest forward from your hips and extend your arms back.  Pinky fingers up and thumbs down.  Keep your hips squared and a ninety degree bend in your front knee.
lunge_crescent_kneeling_forward_arms_sid.Pose Benefits: Stretches and strengthens the shoulders, arms and back muscles.  Stretches the thighs, calves and hips.

lunge_crescent_kneeling_forward_bend.Pose Name: Crescent Lunge Halfway Fold on the Knee
lunge_crescent_kneeling_forward_bend.Pose Description: The front knee is bent in a 90-degree angle directly above the ankle and the back knee is resting on the earth with the top of the back foot pressed firmly into the earth.  The hips are squared and pressed forward.  The inner thighs are scissored toward each other.  The pelvis is tucked under to protect the low back.  The ribcage is lifted.  The arms are lifted.  The hands can be together or separated and facing each other with the fingers spread wide.  The lower body stays static.  The upper torso gently bends forward from the crease of the hip with a straight line.  The gaze is forward.
lunge_crescent_kneeling_forward_bend.Pose Benefits: Creates flexible strength.  Promotes stability in the front and back of the torso.  Tones the lower body.  Stretches the chest, lungs, shoulders, arms, neck, belly, groins (psoas) and the muscles of the back.  Strengthens and stretches the thighs, calves and ankles.

lunge_kneeling_prayer.Pose Name: Crescent Lunge on the Knee with Prayer Hands
lunge_kneeling_prayer.Pose Description: From Crescent Lunge pose, bend the back knee and lower it to the floor with the top foot flat.  Tuck the pelvis under, lift the sternum and lower the hands to heart center into prayer hands.  Stack the front knee directly above the ankle.
lunge_kneeling_prayer.Pose Benefits: Simpler version of Crescent Lunge pose.  Stretches the chest, lungs, and the back muscles.  Strengthens and stretches the thighs.

lunge_crescent_kneeling_eagle.Pose Name: Crescent Lunge on the Knee with Eagle Arms
lunge_crescent_kneeling_eagle.Pose Description: Begin in your Crescent Lunge on the Knee.  Take your eagle arm bind by placing one elbow on top of the other.  Lift your elbows in line with your shoulders and draw your forearms away from your face.  If possible, keep wrapping your arms until your palms meet; otherwise press the back of your hands towards each other.
lunge_crescent_kneeling_eagle.Pose Benefits: Strengthens and stretches the thighs, shoulders, arms and back muscles.

lunge_kneeling_twist.Pose Name: Revolved Crescent Lunge on the Knee
lunge_kneeling_twist.Pose Description: From Crescent Lunge on the Knee with Prayer Hands, slowly twist the spine to one side, hooking the elbow outside of the knee.  Stack the shoulders on top of each other, keep the heart open and gaze up toward the sky.
lunge_kneeling_twist.Pose Benefits: Lengthens and stretches the spine.  Creates flexibility in the rib cage.  Stimulates the internal abdominal organs and kidneys.

lunge_crescent_kneeling_eagle_backbend.Pose Name: Crescent Lunge on the Knee with Eagle Arm Backbend
lunge_crescent_kneeling_eagle_backbend.Pose Description: Begin in your Crescent Lunge on the Knee with Eagle Arms.  Hinge your chest upward and back.  Take your gaze towards your fingers and beyond, allowing your neck to release back.  Keep sending energy to your 90-degree bend in your front knee and stay squared towards the front.  Elbows stay in line with your shoulders and your forearms press away from your face.
lunge_crescent_kneeling_eagle_backbend.Pose Benefits: Stretches and strengthens the shoulders, arms and back muscles.  Stretches the thighs, calves and hips.  Opens the chest and heart.

lunge_crescent_kneeling_hands_on_hips.Pose Name: Crescent Lunge on the Knee with Hands on Hips
lunge_crescent_kneeling_hands_on_hips.Pose Description: From Crescent Lunge on the Knee, place your hands on your hips.  The hips are squared.  The front knee is bent in a 90-degree angle directly above the ankle.  The back knee is bumped back as far as possible and the top of the toes are on the ground.  The tailbone is down. The ribcage is lifted.  The arms are by the side body with the hands resting on the hips.  The gaze is forward.
lunge_crescent_kneeling_hands_on_hips.Pose Benefits: Creates flexible strength.  Promotes stability in the front and back of the torso.  Tones the lower body and stretches the psoas.

lunge_crescent_kneeling_bind.Pose Name: Crescent Lunge on the Knee with King Pigeon
lunge_crescent_kneeling_bind.Pose Description: Begin in your Crescent Lunge on the Knee with Hands on Hips.  Shift your hips forward to deepen the stretch.  Bend your back knee and bring your foot inward towards your body.  Ensure the weight is distributed where the thigh and knee meet and not on the kneecap.  Lift your arms to the sky then lift your chest upward and back to take a deeper backbend.  Reach one hand back to catch the same side foot and then the other hand.  Rotate your elbows up to allow your knuckles to face backwards and your elbows to point slightly towards the sky.
lunge_crescent_kneeling_bind.Pose Benefits: Stretches the thighs, groins, shoulders, hip flexors, spine and opens the hips and chest.

lunge_crescent_kneeling_hands_interlaced.Pose Name: Crescent Lunge on the Knee with Hands Interlaced
lunge_crescent_kneeling_hands_interlaced.Pose Description: Begin in Crescent Lunge on the Knee.  Interlaced your hands behind your back and lift through your sternum.  Keep your hips squared toward the front.  Gaze upwards.
lunge_crescent_kneeling_hands_interlaced.Pose Benefits: Stretches the chest, lungs, neck, belly and groin (psoas).  Strengthens the shoulders, arms and back muscles.  Strengthens and stretches the thighs, calves and ankles.

lunge_crescent_kneeling_triceps.Pose Name: Crescent Lunge on the Knee with Triceps Stretch
lunge_crescent_kneeling_triceps.Pose Description: Begin in Crescent Lunge on the Knee and bend your elbows to bring your thumb knuckles to the back of your neck.  Keep the hips squared and lift up through your rib cage with the option to hinge upward and back while staying balanced on your back toes.
lunge_crescent_kneeling_triceps.Pose Benefits: Stretches the chest, triceps, and hips.  Strengthens the shoulders, arms and back muscles.  Strengthens the thighs, calves and ankles.

lunge_crescent_kneeling_eagle_forward.Pose Name: Crescent Lunge Halfway Fold on the Knee with Eagle Arms
lunge_crescent_kneeling_eagle_forward.Pose Description: Begin in Crescent Lunge on the Knee with Eagle Arms.  Hinge from your hip keeping a flat back and your neck a natural extension of your spine.  Keep your hips squared and a ninety degree bend in your front knee.  Elbows stay in line with your shoulders and your forearms press away from your face.
lunge_crescent_kneeling_eagle_forward.Pose Benefits: Stretches and strengthens the shoulders, arms and back muscles.  Stretches the thighs, calves and hips.

lunge_kneeling_twist_extended_bound.Pose Name: Bound Revolved Crescent Lunge on the Knee
lunge_kneeling_twist_extended_bound.Pose Description: From Revolved Crescent Lunge on the Knee with Arms Extended, lower the top hand around the back with palm facing out.  Bottom hand wraps underneath the thigh.  Bend the elbow and extend the hand to reach the other hand.  Bind the hands together.  If the hands cannot reach, use a strap.  Heart is open.  The gaze is over the top shoulder.
lunge_kneeling_twist_extended_bound.Pose Benefits: Deeply stretches the spine, chest, lungs, shoulders and groin.  Stimulates the internal abdominal organs and kidneys.

lunge_crescent_kneeling_twist_reverse.Pose Name: Exalted Crescent Lunge Twist on the Knee
lunge_crescent_kneeling_twist_reverse.Pose Description: The front foot of one leg is rooted on the earth with the knee directly above and tracking the ankle in a 90-degree angle.  The knee of the back leg is down on the earth.  The inner thighs scissor toward each other and the pelvis is tucked under with the ribcage lifted and the chin slightly tucked.  The spine is long and extended.  The heart is open.  The arm corresponding to the front leg reaches back and touches the thigh of the back leg.  The other arm extends upwards toward the sky and slightly toward the back.
lunge_crescent_kneeling_twist_reverse.Pose Benefits: Creates flexible strength.  Promotes stability in the front and back of the torso.  Tones the lower body.  Stretches the chest, lungs, shoulders, arms, neck, belly, groins (psoas) and the muscles of the back.  Strengthens and stretches the thighs, calves and ankles.

wide_legged_forward_bend_iv_preparation.Pose Description: Transitional pose to get into Wide Legged Forward Bend IV.

marichi_iv_traditional_preparation.Pose Description: Transitional pose to get into Sage Marichi's IV.

head_to_knee_preparation.Pose Description: Transitional pose to get into Head to Knee I.

seated_forward_bend_iii_preparation.Pose Description: Transitional pose to get into Seated Forward Bend III.

fish.Pose Description: From Fish, extend your arms forward with palms to touch in prayer and lift the legs.  The toes are engaged.  The gaze is either up toward the sky or to the back of room, depending on your flexibility.
fish.Pose Benefits: Opens the chest, throat and abdomen.

corpse_extended.Pose Description: Begin by lying flat on your mat, legs extended, arms by your side body.  Bring your big toes to touch and extend your arms up over your head to lengthen out your body.
corpse_extended.Pose Benefits: Releases tension in the lower back, shoulders and legs.

corpse_constructive.Pose Description: Come into a supine position.  Bend your knees and take your feet a little wider than hip width apart.  Allow your knees to fall in towards each other and rest.
corpse_constructive.Pose Benefits: Relaxes the back and hip flexors.

boat_bind_outside_edge_preparation.Pose Description: Transitional pose to get into Boat with Thighs to Chest.

corpse_front_neck_stretch.Pose Name: Reverse Corpse with Ear to Mat
corpse_front_neck_stretch.Pose Description: Lie all the way down onto your belly and extend your legs straight back.  Bring your hands by your side body and turn your head to the side.  Relax your neck, belly, glutes and legs.  Allow your heels to soften to the sides.  Close your eyes, rest and breathe.
corpse_front_neck_stretch.Pose Benefits: Relaxes the body and calms the mind.

setu_preparation.Pose Description: Transitional pose to get into Extended Bridge.Begin in Bound Angle.  Drop your forearms behind you, palms down, fingertips forward and begin to lean back.  Press your shoulder blades together and slide your glutes back toward the tops of your hands.  Once you feel safe, drop the crown of your head onto the ground and gaze behind you.  Stay on the crown of your head and lift your chest toward the sky.

corpse_neck_stretch.Pose Description: Begin in your Corpse by lying flat on your mat.  Mindfully turn your head to the side.  Left ear towards your left shoulder, hold and then right ear towards your right shoulder.
corpse_neck_stretch.Pose Benefits: Releases tension in the neck, lower back, shoulders and legs.

knee_pile_bind_forward.Pose Description: Begin in Box.  Cross one knee behind the other.  Separate your feet enough and sit in between your heels.  Try to keep your knee pile as you take a seat.  Take any position with your hands, such as your shoulder opener:  Lift one arm in the sky, bend at the elbow and drop your hand toward the middle of your back.  Bring your opposite hand to meet it by wrapping it to the small of your back and up toward the middle of your back.  Catch opposite fingertips or use a strap to connect.  Fold over your knee pile as you keep a long spine.
knee_pile_bind_forward.Pose Benefits: Open hips, glutes, ankles, thighs, shoulders, armpits, chest, deltoids and triceps.  Aids in chronic knee pain.  Strengthens the spine and abdominals.

seated_forward_bend_iv_preparation.Pose Description: Transitional pose to get into Seated Forward Bend IV.

shoulderstand_supported_bridge_one_legge.Pose Description: Begin in Supported Bridge.  With the hips high, lift one leg into the sky.  Energize through your top leg and bring it perpendicular to the ground.  Continue to press the big toe down on your grounded foot.  Keep lifting the hips high and press your chest up and back.  Keep the natural curvature of your spine and your eye gaze upward.  Breathe and repeat on the other side.
shoulderstand_supported_bridge_one_legge.Pose Benefits: Stretches the shoulders, chest and back.  Strengthens the hips and legs.

shoulderstand_supported_one_legged.Pose Description: From Supported Shoulder Stand, walk your elbows in towards each other as much as possible.  Keep the hips in line with the shoulders and drop one leg behind you allowing the toes to find the ground.  The weight rests on the center of the back of your skull and the neck maintains its natural curvature.  The chest reaches towards the chin and the gaze is inward.  This pose can also be entered from Plow.  Lift one leg in the sky while leaving the opposite toes on the ground.
shoulderstand_supported_one_legged.Pose Benefits: Increases circulation.  Improves strength and flexibility in the back, shoulders, neck and legs.

shoulderstand_supported_side.Pose Description: Begin in your Supported Shoulder Stand.  Keep your legs engaged and sealed together.  Rotate your hips, legs and toes to one side.  Repeat on the opposite side.
shoulderstand_supported_side.Pose Benefits: Stretches the shoulders and neck.  Tones the legs and buttocks.

shoulderstand_supported_one_legged_side.Pose Description: Begin in One Legged Shoulder Stand.  Continue to extend your top leg upward and with control, walk your bottom foot out to the side bringing your foot in line with your chest as much as possible.
shoulderstand_supported_one_legged_side.Pose Benefits: Improves strength and flexibility in the back, shoulders, neck and legs.

shiva_squat_prayer.Pose Description: From Shiva Squat, lift your chest and take your hands to your heart.  Keep hugging your top knee behind your standing knee and continue sending your hips back.  Keep your front knee in line with your grounded ankle.  Hips stay square and your core is engaged.
shiva_squat_prayer.Pose Benefits: Stretches the calves, and thighs.  Strengthens the thighs, knees, and ankles.  Improves balance and focus.

supine_thunderbolt.Pose Description: Come into your Bound Lotus.  Mindfully roll back while keeping ahold of your bind.  Land softly on the top of your head.  Chin and chest lifted and make it your intention to press your knees downward as you continue to open your hips.
supine_thunderbolt.Pose Benefits: Stretches the shoulders, knees, ankles and hips.  Strengthens the spine, lower back and upper back.

dolphin_on_toes.Pose Description: From Dolphin, root down into your forearms and come up high on your tiptoes.  The chest presses towards the thighs and the gaze can be neutral or forward.
dolphin_on_toes.Pose Benefits: Stretches the shoulders, hamstrings, calves, arches, and toes.  Strengthens the arms and legs.  Warms up the shoulders, ankles and toes.

seated_hand_to_toe_revolved.Pose Name: Revolved Seated Hand to Big Toe
seated_hand_to_toe_revolved.Pose Description: Begin in a seated position with your legs straight in front.  Hinge forward to reach and place one hand on the outer edge of your opposite foot.  Ground your opposite palm by your hip.  Once you have a strong grip, lift your chest and your leg.  Twist your torso toward the back and extend your opposite arm.  Gaze toward your opposite arm.  Your floating leg can have a slight bend but make it your intention to straighten the leg as much as possible.
seated_hand_to_toe_revolved.Pose Benefits: Strengthens the legs, ankles and core.  Stretches the back of the legs and spine.

crow_side_preparation.Pose Description: Transitional pose to get into Side Crow or Two Legged Sage Koundinya's.Start from Squatting Toe Balance pose with the palms flat on the floor and knees into the chest.  Keep the palms in place, turn the knees about 90 degrees to face one side, so the elbows are in front of the thigh.
